website_summaries.verdict: If you need something simple with a high weight capacity, this is the desk for you.
pros: This is a large and sturdy gaming desk with a simple design that will accommodate any setup
The soft pad makes the entire desk a mouse pad
Assembly is straightforward, though the desk is heavy at 85.5 lbs

customer_reviews.title: This desk is absolutely amazing. The desk was extremely easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This desk is absolutely amazing. The desk was extremely easy to put together. Took about 45 mins per desk and my kids helped which was nice. The desk itself is big so make sure you have the measurements and the right place for it. Cable management was easy with the pre-cut holes. The top is a rolled mat on-top of the wood desk which makes your whole desk a mouse pad. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Willoughby

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy with this desk
customer_reviews.text: This desk is a bunch of wobbly metal with a carpet on top. It's a copy of an Ikea desk with a carpet on top, and the carpet is too big for the desk. It doesn't look high quality and my gamer club laughed at me when they visited my house and saw this ripoff desk. It also wobbles out of control, even though I tightened all the screws, it's just poor quality made in china junk.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and by far the most sturdy ...
customer_reviews.text: This table is absolutely gorgeous. Easy to put together and by far the most sturdy and durable computer table I have ever owned. The cable management system that comes with it is very nice and hides everything well. Everyone loves the top!
customer_reviews.author: HarryPotterAholic

customer_reviews.title: This wobbles more than the cheap plastic fold out table I was using.
customer_reviews.text: I had my two monitors on one of those plastic white foldout tables you see everywhere and never had wobble. I completely forgot that wobble was a complaint about this desk until I got everything set up and got into a game. Barely putting an pressure on the desk and moving the mouse causes both monitors to wobble big time. I even tightened the feet as much as I could like someone else mentioned and the table is against a wall. It's really unfortunate because the table and mouse pad seem really nice but even typing this is causing my monitors to wobble like crazy...tightening the screws on the feet until they were stripped didn't fix the issue either.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad to assemble and the functionality of the desk is miles ahead of what others are doing. The wood has sharp edges on the sides, which digs into my IKEA Markus' armrests. I do like the full-desk mousepad, lol. It does get dirty, though. Overall, I think it was money well spent and it adds a nice addition to my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: quentin

customer_reviews.title: Nice desk
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge desk, I didn’t realize how big it was till I set the thing up. I actually set it up in the living room and it almost didn’t fit moving it from the living room through my doorway into my bedroom. For those that stated it wobbles probably didn’t set it up properly. Their over 50 screws for this thing. Make sure you fasten every screw tight. With my desk their is literally zero wobble. Happy with my purchase big, heavy, sturdy gaming desk.
customer_reviews.author: Blizzard

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DESK
customer_reviews.text: This is one heckuva gaming / simulator desk. I purchased it for a gaming computer / flight simulator in our bonus room upstairs. It is super well built and EASILY holds two large monitors and would hold three. It has a large surface area which is nice because I have a flight yoke, multi-panel and other X-Plane accessories and there is still room for a keyboard and mouse. The net underneath is cool. The curvature of the seating position is a bonus. The mat is brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Eckel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Desk!
customer_reviews.text: Whoa! Very sturdy, heavy, BIIIIIGGG! The desk looks great! and yes thats my wife we put used teamwork and shes hella good at building stuff. It took us about 90 minutes to put together mostly because we couldnt figure out even with watching the video still happened to put those bars together upside down. So that was probably the most difficult part along with getting a few of the screws in the legs to make the frame for the desk but its not because of the manufacturer it was because my hands were getting sweaty and was just hard to get it in the hole :-) Great Desk! got it on Sale! I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond B.

customer_reviews.title: Snagged on sale, massive desk with slight wobble
customer_reviews.text: Snagged one on sale for $200. To me, that is a fair price for the desk. I would not pay full price. Instructions are a bit vague. Definitely wish sides were labeled with stickers like other box assemblies. After assembly sturdiness is decent. After everything is placed on the desk, the wobble is almost gone. For the price of this thing, they should change how your adjust the height on the legs. The mat included is awesome. No longer have to worry about rolling my mouse off a pad again lol. The net included is helpful with hiding most wires and plugins within.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Arce

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth. Solid desk, high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice desk, super heavy in the shipping box but when put together, feels great. Very well designed, has adjustable height, comes with a giant mouse pad that fits the desk, and assembly only took ~1 hour doing it by myself. (Comes with assembly tool, but having a hex screwdriver will help a lot seeing as it is hard to tighten the screws with just a hex key). Pad is somewhat waterproof, so it is ok but not recommended to spill liquids on top, wood is very high quality, dense and heavy. Overall great desk. Very spacious and gets the job done and more.
customer_reviews.author: lekhana

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions, poor material
customer_reviews.text: The instructions to assemble the desk are poorly made and very confusing. I consider myself handy, and I have been building myself furnitures from multiple brands. Following the instructions, I made a mistake and assembled the frame incorrectly, once I tried to revert and unscrew the frame, all screw were stuck and their thread is gone. I will need to go to Home Depot/Lowe's in the morning to get new screws and find a way to remove the old ones. Very disappointed and frustrated, I am considering to return the desk and ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Canevari

customer_reviews.title: Great desk but bad cable mesh
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels great! You may have to loosen up the fasteners, if your top three boards don’t line up flush, and then tighten them back down. I didn’t have an issue with stability or wobble like some other reviewers said. Not sure if they didn’t follow directions properly or had some screws left over after the build. ;) The cable management is somewhat of a joke in my opinion as it doesn’t ‘hold’ anything. It’s just a super tight mesh that can slightly help route cables but not hold anything secure.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ryan Bockholt

customer_reviews.title: Instruction hell and wobble paradise.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were pretty terrible. Wobbles a noticeable amount, even worse if you try to raise it. Can't tighten bolts as they just get super loose and no longer tighten. Several holes couldn't even hold the bolts, they just flat out fell out. Definitely not worth it. Too inconvenient to send back. The cable net is a great idea, but not wide enough to actually do much. Had to zip tie cables through it. I love the amount of space though.
customer_reviews.author: Remi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how I lived without this desk. It is large, the pictures don't do that part justice. The holes in the back fit perfectly with the topper and has amazing cable management. Not having to use a mouse pad anymore because the entire desk is one, was life changing. Couldn't recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Collin Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you assemble it correctly, or you're gonna have wobble!
customer_reviews.text: Make SURE, SURE, SURE that before you finally upright the finished desk, you go back and fully tighten down all four screws on each leg that are at the base of the foot. If you don't do this, the desk will be wobbly. I had to go back after I used it for a bit to tighten these down-- they're almost like lugnuts, so I had to go around them in a circle a few times, tightening each screw down fully. It was only after the three passes that ALL of the screws couldn't be tightened further, and THIS DESK IT ROCK SOLID!
customer_reviews.author: Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Desk looks great, but rocks like a boat. Steer CLEAR.
customer_reviews.text: Steer CLEAR of this desk. It looks amazing, the full size mouse pad/mat is great, but it is not sturdy at all. Desk is unusable because it wobbles so much. Everything was assembled per instructions and all bolts are TIGHT as can be. Poor craftsmanship prevents the parts from fitting together properly. The desk legs rotate and move at the bottom, even with all bolts tight. This is where the movement occurs. Packing up all 100lbs of it and returning in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my brother in law for his bday. He is a huge gamer. He has two monitors. He was the one that put it together and he did say that it took him a little bit of time, but it wasn't hard to put together. He loves that the top of the desk is a giant mouse pad. The colors look great! It isn't fun to move a lot, so make sure you have it where you want it. He said, it shows how sturdy it is though. He wouldn't want it to be light. Anything could turn the table over then. We are so happy that we bought this for him.
customer_reviews.author: BillyJo

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap for the price! Bad desk pad!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this desk for my dedicated gaming setup. While its "ok" for 200 bucks, it would be highway robbery for the list price. Cheap materials. Mouse pad desk mat doesn't track good enough for competitive players. (Plus mine came with a lot of frays in the mat) I would recommend a good sit/stand desk over this. It's just not that special and will come flawed...
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth and Emily

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Build
customer_reviews.text: This is a nightmare to put together. The three boards compromising the table top do not meet evenly and will shift constantly as you try to tighten all the screws. I also recommend ignoring the instructions and instead watch the YouTube video from Arrozzi as this will save a lot of rework, I had one bad screw that would not tighten without stripping , luckily it came with an extra screw. For the price I have built sturdier desks with far less frustration, if it weren't for the size and curve of the desk I would never pay this much money. Product also arrived in a destroyed box with damaged parts.
customer_reviews.author: IronGiant

customer_reviews.title: Better than your standard desk!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, adjustable, and solid. This table is fantastic for a gaming station. Cable management is good, but it could be better. There is netting underneath where you can route your cables to, but it’s mesh and sags when there is too much weight. That should not stop you from buying this table though. Just have to be more creative with your cables. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: CJ Ellett

customer_reviews.title: My son was unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's birthday and he wasn't happy with it. According to him, this is an old model and the newer models feature mousepads with cooler designs, LED lights, usb ports cell phone chargers the list goes on. And as a mom I was thoroughly disappointed since this is the most expensive gaming desk on amazon. It's not the biggest desk, the newest desk, the "coolest" desk, or anything like that... It's just a very ordinary desk, but with a giant price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Tori Nash

customer_reviews.title: Loud, heavy, pretty.
customer_reviews.text: It's looks great and the table pad is very nice. Extremely "heavy" duty. The assembly instructions are a bit vague. The worst part, and why it's such a low score is the single point of weakness. A single bolt using friction to keep it at the set height. Makes horrible screeching noises and wobbles with any movement. Setting it all the way to the floor didn't solve the wobbling issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay, well, umm
customer_reviews.text: It is as advertised but construction is a hit or miss. No real big issues as far as sturdiness and wobble or quality just things like the pre drilled holes dont always line up and the screws may fight you or give up altogether but i only had 4 that lost hope. In the end it was what i wanted, more area and a sleek look and feel. FYI I am not picky on looks but one of the leg stands installed at an angle or offset and i had to plan ahead with my set up to hide this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great table easy to assemble and looks awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a desk, lighten up my office. I love the curve in the middle when I sit if feels like a pocket. Definitely love full mouse pad, this will help be more cleaner and dust free. I feel this price point is perfect. Thanks for a great job, make this great desk.
customer_reviews.author: Madtime

customer_reviews.title: Please read this- best purchase of 2020
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when a lot of reviews noted, "table wobbles". I had this problem at first when I assembled the table quickly(5mins). I soon figured the easy solution, please stay with me. The feet comes pre-assembled in the package; the posts are secured to the feet via 3-4 screws. These screws needed to be tightened and once I did the table did not wobble. It is sturdy enough to hold my weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: 4 starts for crappy shipping same on fedex. The other hand it’s a little wobbly on carpet but it’s sturdy and can hold my full size pc and soon a 43 inch tv for a monitor. Looks grate took me at least a few hours to figure out how to put it together but after watching several different how to videos I finally got it together and can’t be happier with my choice. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. NoBody

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR GAMING!
customer_reviews.text: Pros- This desk is truly amazing! Setup was easy, took maybe 1 hour. You have YouTube as a manual if you need more detail which is always nice. Desk sits comfortably at stock level but I did adjust heights just to experiment. Cord managment worked like a charm with the net that sits fairly tight under desk. Playing PC games for hours has been great, im able to comfortably rest my elbows for superior performance! Cons- This desk (with the mat installed) can get easily dirty. I kinda regret getting an all black. I recommend a vacuum of some kind to pick up the dust over time.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan C.

customer_reviews.title: Great desk
customer_reviews.text: Great product. In my opinion it is a really nice desk for the price. I understand most people can buy a used desk for 50 bucks. Or build one out of a door. But for someone who doesn't want to buy used or build a desk this is a good value for your dollar. I personally would buy it again. The only problem I had was the 3 pieces on each side on the bottom of the desk. They could have made a better description of how they go together. It was a bit confusing at first. That is just my little gripe though.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, solid workstation
customer_reviews.text: I looked forever for a good gaming desk/workstation and finally settled on this. It’s very good, and there’s a lot of room for a keyboard, mouse, and whatever accessories you may have. It’s solid and doesn’t wobble, which is a pet peeve of mine. I particularly like the cord management system and there are openings on the work surface and the giant mouse pad so that the cords don’t have to drape out the back. I wholeheartedly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dangerous Dirk

customer_reviews.title: Arozzi Gaming Desk
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice gaming desk but its a little time consuming to build. A little more than usual. The Z leg desk i bought my son was way easier to build and was a 1 piece top. This Arozzi desk has a 3 piece top and 10 piece under structure. But the final product is great. A little big for 1 gaming device. But a great size if you are supporting multiple gaming platforms.
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: Its bigger than it looks initially, in a damn good way. ;)
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gaming desk ive ever purchased. Love the net, was confused at first - cord management. Perfect height for me. heavy and sturdy, Fits great. 10 minute assembly easy. To top it off i dont need a mouse pad thanks to the stylish top cover with cord management fittings to match table. this is a gamers delight! Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: JJ Hag

customer_reviews.title: NOT WOBBLY
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, these other reviews are off one, I almost didn't buy this desk because of the wobbly reviews. It's an amazing desk, lots of space, cable management, and a giant mousepad. It even goes on sale for really cheap every once in a while. The only con I have is it took a while to put together, and it was really heavy. I mainly had trouble screwing in the legs, since I didn't know you had to screw them in diagonally. Also, the assembly guide is pretty bad, it uses pictures instead of words. However, on their youtube there is a full installation guide.
customer_reviews.author: jamesstangland

customer_reviews.title: Big, Sturdy, and looks good!
customer_reviews.text: Very big, Very nice desk! It's exactly as advertised! Desktop feels very sturdy. My only gripe is the mesh net underneath. I use it for cable management and it should be a little wider. A power strip and some cables feels like a balancing act when you're putting them in. But otherwise, it holds all of my cables and is a very sturdy desk. The full tabletop mouse pad looks great and offers, as you would expect, much greater range of movement than a standard size mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: What I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, just be sure that you center the feet so its not wabling, if you press too hard in the front it might tilt over so add a secure point and you should be good. If this could be made into an L I would buy that section too. I added a solid cable mananger to hide the cables , their cable manager is net and can not hold the weight of a heavy brick. If you like it go for it.
customer_reviews.author: rfpa1

customer_reviews.title: Like the full table mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: Table is very sturdy and will go up against the wall fairly well. The bow in the front of the table does take a little away from the overall table and depending where you have your monitors, the placement of yokes and throttles may be a bit off. It would have been better to have the availability of a slide tray mounted to the front of the table for the keyboard as the yoke goes in the center making it necessary for the keyboard to be off to the side and typing a bit awkward unless you shift your chair over.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: Happiness in a desk
customer_reviews.text: I have had this desk for three weeks now, and it is fantastic. The construction is heavy duty. You will feel the quality when you try to lift the box. Solid steel, thick MDF, and worth every penny. It is a bit kid looking, but all wires fit cleanly in the cable management system, and you will end up with a clean desktop with a lot of working space. Oh and the mousepad top is really clever and a great unique feature.
customer_reviews.author: Luc T.

customer_reviews.title: Love this desk
customer_reviews.text: I really like the desk. It was fairly easy to assemble although Incredibly heavy and is actually larger than I imagined (not a bad thing). I really like the full desk mouse pad as well. My only complaint is that it’s not very sturdy. I had to place it in a corner to gain a little sturdiness. Overall it’s a great gaming desk.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gravely

customer_reviews.title: Own 2 of these, love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these in the house now. They are great desks. Super sturdy, plenty of space, full mouse pad surface. Cable management net is kinda cool. They ought to incorporate some kind of hardware tray instead, but I'm not complaining. This regularly goes on sale, so wait for it to go down about a hundred bucks off and you won't be disappointed. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Instructions, but Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, the instructions are kinda lacking and annoying to follow, but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't cheesing super hard after getting it all together and putting my equipment on it. The desk looks absolutely amazing and is study. So far I'm willing to say it's the nicest computer desk I've ever bought and the wire management is really nice. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: TOWEOatmeal

customer_reviews.title: Very spacious for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Really great, heavy, strong, good looking, and very spacious desk. My son has two monitors and other computer equipment on it and still has room. One leg arrived slightly damaged but I emailed the company and they sent me a replacement right away - great customer service if you need it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ZumaLun

customer_reviews.title: good bargain
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my teenage son, who needs to use it for school / remote learning as well as gaming. Sturdy, nice design, my teenager built it himself. Great work area big enough for gaming, dual screens, works space. Comes with a lining / pad for the surface that is like a mouse pad for the entire top.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Desk, Impossible Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I saw in others reviews that this desk had garbage instructions and they were not kidding! I had to reassemble the base 3 times before I realized the easiest way to assemble the thing was to just match the holes of the frame up to the desk and go from there. Otherwise it's a big sturdy desk and I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Some guy on the Internet

customer_reviews.title: Love this desk!
customer_reviews.text: Great Desk! Solid construction and if you follow the directions is rock solid. The only thing I did was to add wire baskets under the desk instead of using the included netting as I have a few power bricks for various devices and did not feel the netting would be adequate to hold their weight.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Caffray

customer_reviews.title: Mouse pad is thick and nice. cable management is sub-par
customer_reviews.text: Solid table! If you put this together correctly, there should be ZERO wobble. It was my biggest concern when buying this and Im very impressed with its stability. Mouse pad is thick and nice. cable management is sub-par, but works. I have it set on the lowest height, so I have not adjusted it yet. Finish is very good. all the hardware fit well. Directions were OK, a bit of figuring out, but not too bad. No damage during shipping either. All in all, for the money and compared to other tables on the market (not too many) this one is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This desk is rock solid.
customer_reviews.text: I just received the desk this afternoon. After watching the instructional video, I followed the somewhat vague instruction manual and it went off without a hitch. Another reviewer, suggested using another wrench as a fulcrum when tightening the feet to the legs. I did this, and left the rest of screws loose until everything was lined up. After tightening all the screws down, I can say that the desk is rock solid!! I love the look and the feel of the desk. I'm looking forward to many hours of gaming on this monster.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: I'll take 3.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my workstation and it's a total game changer. Its sturdy, adjustable, and large. I bought 2 more for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very large, very sturdy desk
customer_reviews.text: This desk is one of the largest single surface desks ive seen on the market. So the top is two pieces, but when you lay the included whole desk mouse mat over it you would never know it. It is incredibly heavy so get some help lifting it. Overall I am impressed and enjoy this desk.
customer_reviews.author: S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Took about an hour to assemble, not easy but would you expect it to be? It doesn't wobble just from using it but if make a strong movement or rage quitting it will shake. I ordered it in Red but it came in Green. Not a big deal but that's what keeps it from 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sedith

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing equals poor assembled product
customer_reviews.text: Poor manufacturing. Pieces were not machined well/holes and screws did not fit together properly and caused assembly to be difficult and fully assembled product to be unstable such that it needs to be braced against wall and furniture levelers placed under legs. Only didn't return due to hassle of disassembling/finding new packaging/shipping. One positive is good size for the desk space if it were properly stable. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adam V Graham

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered this, a very heavy dumbbell set was left on my doorstep which was a pain to get back to the ups. The replacement item arrived, and I tightened every screw that needed to be tightened and followed the online video tutorial to a T. However, about 1 day after initial use it started to wobble like crazy. When I was gaming I felt like the table could collapse at any moment. It's funny, my cheap foldable table I bought at Walmart is much more sturdy than this 400 dollar "gaming" table. However, the mousepad is great, I'll give it that.
customer_reviews.author: kingballer818

customer_reviews.title: Tedious Assembly, but overall worthwhile.
customer_reviews.text: The assembly process, while simple, takes some patience. You have to make sure you align all the parts level before you put in the final tightening touches to it. Otherwise, you'll end up with a cockeyed desk that wobbles everywhere. Once assembled, the desk matt is of a decent quality, but loves to soak up water and detritus. So I recommend to cover your immediate workspace with another medium mousepad. The size is spectacular, and fits 3, 27" monitors comfortably without needing to mount them. All in all a great desk, if you have a set of tools and some patience.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Q.

customer_reviews.title: Best Gaming Desk
customer_reviews.text: This desk is very nice I got the all black edition for 300$ which ended up being like 315.99 with tax and all and man is this nice idk why people say it wobbles maybe if they tighten the screw it would work better but the space that you get (which is about 5’3 long) is amazing and the net to keep up that cables makes it look so clean for them quality gaming needs so if you want a desk get this one it’s worth the money 100%
customer_reviews.author: Tyrese

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Desk
customer_reviews.text: Pro's Huge sturdy Desk with great cable management system. I got the all black model which leads me to the con. Con's Every little crumb or smudge shows up on this black table top mat. It wipes right off but you need to be careful if you want this to stay nice a long time. Also, when i unpacked the parts one of the legs was missing the round rubber foot. I contacted Arozzi through their website and they responded the same day. within 2 days they shipped me out the missing part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality desk that will last you many years
customer_reviews.text: Took me a bit of time to put together, but if you have a second person helping you it will be faster. Watch out for the black grease in the holes where the cables go through, that stuff will turn your fingers black and take a few days to get off. As long as you tighten all the boots this desk is as solid as a rock. Love that you can adjust height as well. Would definitely buy again if i needed to.
customer_reviews.author: cats88

customer_reviews.title: For the right price...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about $400, but for $200 I think it’s a fantastic value. This thing took a long time tightening, and tightening, and re-tightening the screws to make sure there is no wobble. The table is huge, solid, and has nice additions like the cable holes and net. If you see it for $200 (check the colors) I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cullina

customer_reviews.title: It's a hard pass
customer_reviews.text: Greatest engineering masterpiece since the hindenberg. I loved the directions that looked like my 4 year old nephew drew it with crayons I especially liked the smiley faces they were super helpful and made it feel like a real adult purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great desk for gaming; but a pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I gave this desk 5 stars overall because it looks fantastic and it was exactly what I was looking for. As a hardcore gamer, I shopped around for awhile and went with this and I have zero regrets. The entire surface is also a mousepad, which is awesome. The cable management net is pretty useful too. Some minor issues: - It was a pain to put together until I went on Youtube and watched the Arozzi assembly video because the instructions are probably the most vague I’ve ever seen (and I’ve put together a ton of Ikea furniture). - It seems a little wobbly, but I placed in it a carpeted room so I’m hoping that’s why.
customer_reviews.author: john morgan

customer_reviews.title: It is a good table besides the unfortunate damage
customer_reviews.text: The whole top piece came damaged. I bought it before my room was finished, because it was suppose to be done 2 months before it was finished. I just p it it together today and realized it was damaged. It is a good table besides the unfortunate damage.
customer_reviews.author: dubie

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but not the best on carpet
customer_reviews.text: Currently using this desk on carpet which showed slight wobble until I secured the back to the wall. Even after significantly tightening all the screws at the base of each leg, it still showed signs of slight wobble, but his desk is lightweight which is why it doesn't have much support. However I mainly purchased this desk for the aesthetics and giant mouse pad which has proved its worth.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I love this desk
customer_reviews.text: This desk is wonderful. It's very sturdy with a lot of surface area. Holds 3 of my monitors and my mic stand. Comes with a mouse pad that covers the entire table.
customer_reviews.author: Dat Boi Avlan

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall. Definitely worth the money. Super heavy duty legs and feet. I got the blue painted, and the paint quality is top notch. Great design with plenty of space. I have two 27" monitors side by side, with room to spare. The instructions on putting it together were a little annoying. Would definitely recommend using a quality tool, other than the ones included, to maximize stability.
customer_reviews.author: AudioVideoDisco

customer_reviews.title: Nice desk, some wobble though
customer_reviews.text: As a gaming desk its pretty nice, great for about two 27inch monitors and the the actual PC up on the desk. The only real strike against it is the wobble caused by the legs. A lot of it is caused by the adjustable height, the higher you go the worse the wobble gets as the height is held by just a single screw. Its not unmanageable by any means but if you're in an environment where your desk might get bumped regularly, you might want to pass.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Very nice desk
customer_reviews.text: This table is great, it looks very nice and also preforms just as good. If you have trimming on the bottom of your wall you might have a little bit of rocking just because it cant quire reach the wall due to the trim. But still it is very stable. I put it together in about 2 hours and it was pretty simple to set up. Love the full surface mouse pad and also the 3 cable holes are very conveniently placed. Highly reccomend this table, although I might recommend not buying it at full price for $400 because I don't think it's that good for that price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: Well first of all, the assembly was a disaster. It was just cut wrong or something but with a lot of improvising I was able to assemble it. After the assembly my only complaint is that adjusting the height after assembly is a PAIN. But other than that it’s great in every way. I don’t regret this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Cable Management is a nice feature, but can get overloaded fast
customer_reviews.text: Desk is everything it is advertised to be...The shipping box is heavy and may require a second person to lift. I was able to set the desk up on my own and the assembly instructions are fairly simple to follow. Cable Management is a nice feature, but can get overloaded fast. I could not give it a perfect rating because the desk took a beating during the shipping process. The box came with fairly large impact holes and the desk itself had two small impact marks on it. The damage would have been lot more severe if not for the fact that the desk was packaged fairly well in the box. Overall solid desk... poor shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Tons of space. Great cable management.
customer_reviews.text: I almost did not buy this desk after reading multiple reviews of it not being sturdy... Those people must have not put it together correctly because mine is super sturdy. Doesn't shake or anything and I have a ton of heavyish stuff on it. I did use blue loctite when assembling, maybe that's why idk...great desk for the $, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JuiceBox

customer_reviews.title: Great desk.
customer_reviews.text: I took a shot on this desk despite some of the negative reviews and I'm glad I did. None of the things that were mentioned in the negative reviews appeared with my order. Desktop pieces fit snug, no sharp edges, no damaged edges, all parts fit and I was able to assemble it no problem. Mouse pad desktop, wire management, and height adjust all fit into exactly what I needed and work out wonderfully. Height should probably be determined before you add the top or you'll need at least 3 people to adjust it after table top, monitors and etc are on top.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great desk
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in great condition, box took some damage but nothing inside was damaged. I put it together with an impact drill definitely have to be careful to not strip screws as they arent extremely high quality but with everything tightened good the desk is very sturdy and the mat that goes on top is really nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Zharp

customer_reviews.title: Nice Desk, Wobble-free
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with this desk. The quality is good, assembly time took under an hour, and the mousepad that lays over the top feels nice for gaming or working. It also has manual height adjustment, but I left the desk at its factory height. Many reviews refer to the “wobblyness” of this desk, which I experienced after first putting it together—but don’t worry. To fix this, I flipped the desk back over and tightened the screws in a cross pattern. And to make them extra tight, I used the short end of the provided hex key to get better torque. All fixed and no issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Keola

customer_reviews.title: Solid 9.5/10, much space v good
customer_reviews.text: Wobbly + wood floor = yes (explain) Is it constant or annoying = no Worth the money= 95% I have monitor arm and mic arm taking back and left side so can’t place against the wall 100% but the wobble is super unoticed unless I violently move and push my desk, It’s a great desk, lots of free space and area to work with, great for mounting stuff as well, Other 5% is that it seems over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Great Space
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son, he loves the work space to play games now. The comfort level improved for him. Great surface for game playing. Made small mistake during assy, but fixed it. Everything else went well. He enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Erndawg

customer_reviews.title: Very nice desk
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Easy to assemble. Love the multiple holes for cords. Ours is on carpet so it’s probably not quite as solid as it would be on hard flooring but it’s still sturdy. Right now one of our monitors shakes because the stand is cheap but we had already planned to mount the monitors on the wall so it’s a temporary issue. Still working on cable management—nets work just ok. Probably depends how many cables you have—we have a lot. But overall the desk is what we expected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming desk for good price
customer_reviews.text: Excuse the mess! Forgot to take a pic before loading it up lol. It’s a great desk. I love that the top is basically a mouse pad so I don’t need to buy one. It’s comfy. It was also fairly simple to put together. The instructions were only pictures, no words, so that was interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Exquisite gaming desk
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 13 year old son's birthday. He was ecstatic to receive it!!! We followed the set up instructions from YouTube which was very helpful. This is a very sturdy desk. We have not experienced any wobbliness or imbalance and we have it on thick carpet. My son absolutely loves the whole desk mouse pad and the spaciousness of the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: This desk is awesome! The assembly was a bit of a pain ...
customer_reviews.text: This desk is awesome! The assembly was a bit of a pain though, try to have a second person help if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Quality Gaming Desk
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase! High quality materials on the desk itself. Sturdy. The mouse pad is great but will of course have to be replaced at some point. The net for cable management feels like it is not the best of quality. The instructions that came with the package are not to good, some advice on that would be to look up the video they post on YouTube, the guy did a great job with instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Saint

customer_reviews.title: Great desk, a bit difficult to assemble, grab a friend.
customer_reviews.text: I love this desk, I love it to death. Do you play on low sensitivity and run out of mouse pad? Not anymore unless you have 7 foot long arms. Assembly was a bit rough (did it by myself) But outside of that I can recommend this to any PC gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Angus

customer_reviews.title: If I need a big size gaming desk, this is the best choice for you.
customer_reviews.text: This is very cool gaming desk for me, the size is big, I can do anything with it. good price for a gaming desk like this. This desk the price change often, so I can check it every week, get it when its price good.
customer_reviews.author: starkids

customer_reviews.title: Rough start but VERY satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I actually had a terrible experience putting this desk together and actually thought about sending it back before I had even completely assembled it BUT I took another crack at it today and got it together and now I'm very very very pleased it looks awesome crips and clean and when put together correctly it is actually sturdy PLEASE if the sellers or manufacturers read this revise the manual its to simplified and update your YouTube channels assembly guide video other than the rough start im very pleased with it and I do actually recommend this desk
customer_reviews.author: Kicks&Tricks

customer_reviews.title: Whats with the price changes?!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this desk BUT..... I am looking to get a second and it seems the price has been raised from $250 to $450 now back down to $350. I will not purchase another until the price is back to where it was!
customer_reviews.author: Kerstetter’s

customer_reviews.title: Desk Above The Rest
customer_reviews.text: The Arozzi Arena Gaming Desk is a work horse. My 9 yo son loves it. He’ll grow into it, it’s huge. I’m pretty crafty so I was able to put it together by myself. It’s built to last and is heavy as sin.
customer_reviews.author: Mill Neck Mom

customer_reviews.title: and we love the concept of it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend, and we love the concept of it, which is why I got it for him. But when we received this product, a lot of the parts were really scratched off and the items came uneven? So it was hard to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: A beast
customer_reviews.text: A bit hard to assemble... I would get a second person to help you with it.. But it is an amazing desk holds 2 monitors, and my desktop flawlessly. (Barely any room for cable management in the nets underneath)
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good desk but you need to buy extra bolts for the feet not to wobble
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy like most people have said. The reason and cause is the four bolts on each foot are 8mx25mm they need to be 8mx30mm. I went to lowes bought 30’s and the desk doesn’t move at all.
customer_reviews.author: peter harris

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sturdy desk lots of space.
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with my desk. The desk pad is great. Lots of desk space the cabling net works well. Installation was pretty straight forward (at least to me) I did see a video which explains the install for those you would rather not try to read the given instructions. Bought this desk on sale if not me personally I may not have bought it. It is very solid and sturdy definitely not going to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: So much space, three spots to feed cables up, net underneath to hide cables all very nice. Assembly took some time, but no more than an hour or so. I can make it wobble back and forth if I try, but I have it on carpet and it doesn't wobble under gameplay so I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Magnanti

customer_reviews.title: For the price would have expected more
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were difficult for me to follow but I don’t do well with picture type instructions. I would have preferred written out. The desk was also not sturdy at all. My husband ended up anchoring to the wall with L brackets. After that, our son loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming desk!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I waited to buy this instead of a different company. This desk is the best!!! 5 stars all the way through!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy an arozzi product again.
customer_reviews.text: Today I received my desk. It was missing half the hardware to put it together. So I call arozzi support only to be told it’s a two week lead time to get the bolts to put the desk together. On top of it the guy who answered decided to be smart with me about it. Continued to take the desktop out of the box and all the corners of each piece of desk are chipping
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Coover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Desk and easy to put together with instructions with pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy desk to put together that has instructions with the pictures but if you want additional verification you can watch the video. I am happy with my purchase and my new found restate. Also, the desk is stable on carpet.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product

Come short of drilling new holes this is a very bad made and quality control inspected desk. And of course it's from china. As soon as i can figure out how to box up this mess its going back, Save your hard earn money .
customer_reviews.author: Retiredold

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product, poor shipping
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seems very good quality, but the shipping was very poor. Box came damaged in several places which ended up showing as damage to the top of the table. Easy to put together, but plenty of screws (and heavy!), which is good because it seems very sturdy. Haven't placed anything in it yet, but the netting and three areas to drop cables looks like it will control everything well. The mouse cover can be overlayed on top which looks good which is a plus since the actual table top came damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Schyler Houck

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for myself and my husband. It is an excellent gaming desk. I appreciate how heavy and sturdy this table us. The surface area of the table top is quite large. The mousepad topper is very durable and appears to be good quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jsander1123

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this desk in order to have a nice gaming desk. I followed the instructions, along with their video on how to put it together. The pieces all seem to not fit correctly and the whole desk is a wobbly mess. No matter how tight I tighten the feet, the left one is constant moving around, and causes the entire desk to shake. The three pieces for the table top constantly come apart, and I am disgusted I spent $400 on this. All the screws with washers seem to be popping out after about two weeks of use, and I feel like tossing the whole thing out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Overall
customer_reviews.text: Nice desk, plenty of space for monitors, peripherals, etc., and seems (mostly) well thought out. My main gripe is with the wobble, which I have been unable to completely fix. Tried following the instructions Arozzi posted on YouTube to no avail. Overall, I am happy with the desk, just wish that more thought would have been put in to the base attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hardcore gamers
customer_reviews.text: Have had this desk for almost a month now and I absolutely love it! It’s super nice having the entire surface of the desk as a mousepad and how easy it is to clean. Highly recommend this desk!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great overall
customer_reviews.text: The desk is great overall. The one thing I dislike is if you raise the height. It is not sturdy at all and wobbles back and forth. Which is disappointing for a desk that cost so much.
customer_reviews.author: 370gt

customer_reviews.title: came with the broken ends of the table
customer_reviews.text: the table is good but shipping probably broke it when unloading it or placing it in front of the door of my house, keep that in mind because it has already happened to me when I buy furniture through amazon, the prices are good but they are broken
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A Battistelli

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This desk team impact beautifully, very easy to assemble, looks beautiful. I am a super gamer who streams a lot and I knew the perfect ask this desk is perfect and having the whole top of the desk as a mouse pad makes it easier one step ahead of the competition. I love this desk.
customer_reviews.author: Tony K

customer_reviews.title: Good Desk Great Support and UPS sucks
customer_reviews.text: Like some reviewers my desk arrived beet to hell by UPS looked like they played kick ball then drooped it off a two story building. Contacted Arozzi support and whiten a week they had the replacement parts to me. Aside from the shipping damages it is a solid strong desk only long term problem i see is the screws that hold the legs at a set height could fail with time.

product_meta.title: Arozzi Arena Gaming Desk - Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackGaming takes center stage in AROZZI arena-the all new gaming desk. Its huge 14 square feet (1.31 sq. Meters) of rock solid surface and custom mouse pad to cover the full space liberates you to game with new intensity. Arena is a completely new design, developed by our Swedish design team with gamers to maximize play and comfort. The 160cm (5’ 3”) width allows for three large monitors to envelop you in the game environment. The 82 cm (2’ 8 ¼”) depth gives you a huge field of play for your mouse, keyboard or other devices. And it all fits cleanly thanks to arena’s unique cable management scheme. Arena's use of high density, solid construction materials means that gamers will have a stable, placid surface to work with allowing for lightning fast responses and comfort. The customized mouse pad covers 100% of the surface and adheres tightly to the desktop with special materials. The substantial all-metal base supports it all firmly and is user adjustable for height, further enhancing comfort. The arena has a myriad of other features which show the careful attention to detail of AROZZI Swedish design team and their immersion into the needs of gamers around the world. Those features include the design of the custom mouse pad which has a microfiber cloth surface which is water-resistant and machine washable. The mousepad’s edges are stitched and the pad is 5 mm thick to maximize user comfort. Finally, the whole mousepad weighs an impressive seven pounds (3.2 kg) which together with the non-slip underside means it is impervious to any random movement over the surface. Arena is available in five attractive colors to suit the tastes or needs of any gamer, red, blue, green, white and black. Finally, arena is designed for easy transport since the desk top and frame are divided into three sections and fit into packaging easily transportable by package couriers and can be readily shipped to the homes and offices of end users around the globe.
